## harp-geoutils package

|  Class | Description |
|  --- | --- |

|  [FlatTileBoundingBoxGenerator](./harp-geoutils.flattileboundingboxgenerator.md) | <code>FlatTileBoundingBoxGenerator</code> generates bounding boxes in world and geo coordinates for a given TilingScheme. |
|  [GeoBox](./harp-geoutils.geobox.md) | <code>GeoBox</code> is used to represent a bounding box in geo coordinates. |
|  [GeoCoordinates](./harp-geoutils.geocoordinates.md) | <code>GeoCoordinates</code> is used to represent geo positions. |
|  [MercatorConstants](./harp-geoutils.mercatorconstants.md) |  |
|  [OrientedBox3](./harp-geoutils.orientedbox3.md) |  |
|  [Projection](./harp-geoutils.projection.md) | <code>Projection</code> is used to convert positions from geo coordinates to world coordinates and vice versa. |
|  [QuadTree](./harp-geoutils.quadtree.md) | A class used to represent a quadtree. |
|  [SubTiles](./harp-geoutils.subtiles.md) |  |
|  [TileKey](./harp-geoutils.tilekey.md) | The <code>TileKey</code> instances are used to address a tile in a quadtree.<!-- -->A tile key is defined by a row, a column, and a level. The tree has a root at level 0, with one single tile. On every level, each tile is divided into four children (therefore the name quadtree).<!-- -->Within each \[\[level\]\], any particular tile is addressed with \[\[row\]\] and \[\[column\]\]. The number of rows and columns in each level is 2 to the power of the level. This means: On level 0, only one tile exists, \[\[columnsAtLevel\]\]() and \[\[rowsAtLevel\]\]() are both 1. On level 1, 4 tiles exist, in 2 rows and 2 columns. On level 2 we have 16 tiles, in 4 rows and 4 columns. And so on.<!-- -->A tile key is usually created using \[\[fromRowColumnLevel\]\]() method.<code>TileKey</code> instances are immutable, all members return new instances of <code>TileKey</code> and do not modify the original object.<!-- -->Utility functions like \[\[parent\]\](), \[\[changedLevelBy\]\](), and \[\[changedLevelTo\]\]() allow for easy vertical navigation of the tree. The number of available rows and columns in the tile's level is given with \[\[rowCount\]\]() and \[\[columnCount\]\]().<!-- -->Tile keys can be created from and converted into various alternative formats:<!-- -->- \[\[toQuadKey\]\]() / \[\[fromQuadKey\]\]() - string representation 4-based - \[\[toHereTile\]\]() / \[\[fromHereTile\]\]() - string representation 10-based - \[\[mortonCode\]\]() / \[\[fromMortonCode\]\]() - number representation<!-- -->Note - as JavaScript's number type can hold 53 bits in its mantissa, only levels up to 26 can be represented in the number representation returned by \[\[mortonCode\]\](). |
|  [TileKeyUtils](./harp-geoutils.tilekeyutils.md) |  |
|  [TileTreeTraverse](./harp-geoutils.tiletreetraverse.md) |  |
|  [TilingScheme](./harp-geoutils.tilingscheme.md) | The <code>TilingScheme</code> represents how the data is tiled. |
|  [TransverseMercatorUtils](./harp-geoutils.transversemercatorutils.md) |  |

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [isBox3Like(object)](./harp-geoutils.isbox3like.md) | Returns true if the given object implements the \[\[Box3Like\]\] interface. |

## Interfaces

|  Interface | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [Box3Like](./harp-geoutils.box3like.md) | An interface representing bounding box in world coordinates. |
|  [GeoBoxExtentLike](./harp-geoutils.geoboxextentlike.md) | Represents an object that carry \[\[GeoBox\]\] extents like interface. |
|  [GeoCoordinatesLike](./harp-geoutils.geocoordinateslike.md) | Represents an object with <code>GeoCoordinates</code> like interface. |
|  [LatLngLike](./harp-geoutils.latlnglike.md) | Represents an object with <code>LatLng</code> like interface. |
|  [OrientedBox3Like](./harp-geoutils.orientedbox3like.md) | The interface \[\[OrientedBox3Like\]\] is used to represent oriented bounding box. |
|  [SubdivisionScheme](./harp-geoutils.subdivisionscheme.md) | Interface representing a <code>SubdivisionScheme</code>. |
|  [TransformLike](./harp-geoutils.transformlike.md) | The interface \[\[TransformLike\]\] is used to represent transforms with only translation and rotation. |
|  [Vector3Like](./harp-geoutils.vector3like.md) | Interface representing a Vector3. |

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [equirectangularProjection](./harp-geoutils.equirectangularprojection.md) | Equirectangular \[\[Projection\]\] used to convert geo coordinates to world coordinates and vice versa. |
|  [halfQuadTreeSubdivisionScheme](./harp-geoutils.halfquadtreesubdivisionscheme.md) | A \[\[SubdivisionScheme\]\] used to represent half quadtrees. This particular subdivision scheme is used by the HERE tiling scheme. |
|  [hereTilingScheme](./harp-geoutils.heretilingscheme.md) | \[\[TilingScheme\]\] used by most of the data published by HERE.<!-- -->The <code>hereTilingScheme</code> features a half quadtree subdivision scheme and an equirectangular projection. |
|  [identityProjection](./harp-geoutils.identityprojection.md) | Identity \[\[Projection\]\] used to convert geo coordinates to unit coordinates and vice versa. |
|  [mercatorProjection](./harp-geoutils.mercatorprojection.md) | Mercator \[\[Projection\]\] used to convert geo coordinates to world coordinates and vice versa. |
|  [mercatorTilingScheme](./harp-geoutils.mercatortilingscheme.md) | The \[\[TilingScheme\]\] used by the HERE web tiles.<!-- -->The <code>mercatorTilingScheme</code> features a quadtree subdivision scheme and a Mercator projection. |
|  [normalizedEquirectangularProjection](./harp-geoutils.normalizedequirectangularprojection.md) | Equirectangular \[\[Projection\]\] used to convert geo coordinates to unit coordinates and vice versa. |
|  [polarTilingScheme](./harp-geoutils.polartilingscheme.md) | A \[\[TilingScheme\]\] featuring quadtree subdivision scheme and transverse Mercator projection. |
|  [quadTreeSubdivisionScheme](./harp-geoutils.quadtreesubdivisionscheme.md) | \[\[SubdivisionScheme\]\] representing a quadtree. |
|  [sphereProjection](./harp-geoutils.sphereprojection.md) |  |
|  [transverseMercatorProjection](./harp-geoutils.transversemercatorprojection.md) | Transverse Mercator \[\[Projection\]\] used to convert geo coordinates to world coordinates and vice versa. |
|  [webMercatorProjection](./harp-geoutils.webmercatorprojection.md) | Web Mercator \[\[Projection\]\] used to convert geo coordinates to world coordinates and vice versa. |
|  [webMercatorTilingScheme](./harp-geoutils.webmercatortilingscheme.md) | A \[\[TilingScheme\]\] featuring quadtree subdivision scheme and web Mercator projection. |
